title: Get additional interest categories by ID

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: keyword_query
parameters.description: Information of the additional interest category you want to get. Max size = 50.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Additional interest category language. Default value: en . Supported languages: fr , id , it , ja , ms , ar , vi , en , ru , es , th , tr , hi , zh , de , ko .

parameters.name: audience_type
parameters.description: The audience type that you want to filter by. Enum values: GENERAL_INTEREST : General interest. The audiences have a general, long-term interest in a video category. PURCHASE_INTENTION : Purchase intent. The audiences' recent behavior suggests they may buy something related to a content category. Default value: GENERAL_INTEREST .

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: The return code. For the complete list of error codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: The return message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Whether an additional interest category will be effective. Enum values: EFFECTIVE , INEFFECTIVE . An additional interest category is effective if using it can reach a reasonable number of people. An additional interest category is ineffective if the projected audience size is too small. Note : Only effective additional interest categories can be used in ad groups to target audiences.
